item.title: Anthony Lester
item.description:
Anthony Lester

This is my scrapbook of all things that interest, amuse, fascinate and inspire me in the world of swimming, cycling and running. I could have done it on facebook but all my friends and family are probably sick to death of my constant witterings and ramblings.

item.title: 5 Ways A Morning Run Will Change Your Life - Running Motivation
item.description:
5 Ways A Morning Run Will Change Your Life - Running Motivation

Audio available on: iTunes: https://goo.gl/rA6zAa Spotify: http://goo.gl/BJ17BZ Amazon: http://goo.gl/ApncDO Website: http://www.Yourworldwithin.com Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Yourworldwithin Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/eddiepinero2 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/eddiepinero2 Created at Your World Within Speech by Eddie Pinero For speaking Inquiries: http://www.yourworldwithin.com/hire-me-to-speak/ All copyrights go to their respective owners. item.title: Sub 3hr marathon training, Spring '16
item.description:
Sub 3hr marathon training, Spring '16

One of the many things I have learned about running and in particular training,  over the last five years is that you can only succeed if you have a goal. If you don't have a goal there is no incentive to train 'hard'. I use the term 'hard' because I actually enjoy running and would more than happily just go for a jog in the countryside, but that is not training. What I mean is having the discipline to go out when the weather is lashing it down, pushing yourself for that last 2miles of a threshold run when it would be so easy to pack it in early, after all who is ever going to know?

item.title: [Run Tip#1]:
item.description:
[Run Tip#1]:

Runners as a rule rarely warm-up beyond lacing up and starting off slow. Yes the occasional toe touch goes in the right direction...but falls woefully short of "undoing" all the time spent in stiff positions at work, in the car, or at home.!

item.title: My Winter Run
item.description:
My Winter Run

A winter run in Bushy Park

item.title: Dynamic Vs. Static Stretching
item.description:
Dynamic Vs. Static Stretching

Despite the fact that in recent years it has been in vogue to discredit the value of stretching, the combination of dynamic and static stretching-when used at the right time-can have a big impact on increasing flexibility and improving performance.

item.title: The Ultimate Guide To Running Faster Without Getting Injured
item.description:
The Ultimate Guide To Running Faster Without Getting Injured

The "secret" to running faster, stronger, and healthier running is not what you think. It's not buying the "right" shoe or finding the "perfect" running plan. It's not trying this one "special" exercise either or taking a pill.

item.title: Can You Eat to Run?
item.description:
Can You Eat to Run?

How important is diet to running performance? Dan Saladino looks at, and tries new ideas.

item.title: Last run of the year, the final rays of 2015
item.description:
Last run of the year, the final rays of 2015

On my last run of the year I caught the final rays of 2015, a beautiful sight and a perfect time for reflection and to look foward to the next 12 months. Happy New Year to all! #nye2015 #runphotos #topofthehill #sunset

item.title: How parkrun became a global phenomenon
item.description:
How parkrun became a global phenomenon

On Saturday at 9am, about 80,000 people - more than twice the number who take part in the London Marathon - will gather in parks across the country to run, jog and walk five kilometres. Parents with buggies, children and grandparents, super-fit sprinters, dog walkers and people with disabilities, as well as volunteers, will come together at hundreds of courses across the UK.
